text.title: TREASURY S BAKER SAYS SYSTEM NEEDS STABILITY
text.body: Treasury Secretary James Baker floating exchange rate system been as effective as been hoped promoting stability preventing imbalances emerging global economy remarks before afternoon session International Monetary Fund s Interim Committee Baker he suggesting system should be abandoned But I do suggest he that we need something to give more stability to keep headed right direction when wind shifts He indicators can serve as kind compass but added structural indicators can help focus attention on some policies Baker however IMF needs to move beyond macroeconomic indicators find structural indicators can help focus attention on some policies specific relevance to imbalances we face today Treasury Secretary indicators should be given more prominent role annual economic reviews Article IV consultations Fund performs Baker also told policy making group time IMF to adopt earlier recommendations making IMF surveillance more relevant to national policymakers public In particular we urge increased publicity IMF appraisals developed Article IV consultations use follow up reports on country actions to implement IMF recommendations greater use special consultation procedures he Baker emphasized indicators were device for moving beyond rhetoric to action He they provide more structure to system induce more discipline peer pressure into process policy coordination He Fund s procedures surveillance need to be reviewed updated to reflect use indicators This should be matter priority executive board he Baker also urged Fund to develop alternative medium term economic scenarios countries can help us focus even more clearly on most important imbalances by identifying options addressing them analyzing implications these options He also further work should be done on finding paths lead toward possible medium term objectives If we to take effective remedial action when there significant deviations intended course then we must more definitive ways indentifying right course key variables he

text.title: U S DOLLAR LOSSES PROPEL BROAD COMMODITY GAINS
text.author: by Keith Leighty Reuters
text.body: Commodities gold to grains to cotton posted solid gains flurry buying today as losses U S dollar rising interest rates kindled fears inflation economic instability Gains were most pronounced on Commodity Exchange New York where gold jumped dlrs closed at dlrs troy ounce silver cents to dlrs troy ounce key factor behind advance anticipation inflation be only way major industrial nations to halt slide value U S dollar Steve Chronowitz director commodity research Smith Barney Harris Upham Co New York dollar tumbled one day after top finance officials seven largest industrial nations reaffirmed their commitment to support value despite reports intervention by U S Federal Reserve Bank traders Traders appears industrial nations known as Group Seven lack ability to change long term direction currency markets Maybe they some ideas or plans Chronowitz If they do s evident It looks like there s no cure but to let free market take values to where they should be One way or another we force our major trading partners to stimulate their economies as measure to correct mounting U S trade deficit Chronowitz I think markets believe believed long time only recourse to reflate at some point s going to be long tedious process but s what s happening he falling value dollar makes U S commodities cheaper foreign buyers stimulating demand At same time traders who holding stocks bonds saw value their investments falling many turning to commodities such as precious metals as hedge Marty McNeill metals analyst New York trading house Dominick Dominick reaction metal markets reverberated throughout commodities markets as grains livestock cotton posted broad gains Traders at Chicago Board Trade attention grain markets shifted concern burdensome supplies to outlook lower dollar stimulate export demand After close trading Agriculture Department raised estimate grain imports by Soviet Union by two tonnes month earlier report Live hogs frozen pork bellies posted sharp gains on Chicago Mercantile Exchange while live cattle were moderately higher Analysts several factors boosted hog prices They hogs haven t been making weight gains normal at time year farmers been too busy field work to market animals

text.title: TREASURY S BAKER CALLS FOR MORE BANK FLEXIBILITY
text.body: Treasury Secretary James Baker commercial banks need to develop more flexibility their concerted lending mechanisms to help assure continued participation new money packages He major debtor nations need to be able to count on receiving timely disbursements on new loans essential to support well conceived economic programs His remarks were made to afternoon session International Monetary Fund s policy making Interim Committee Baker The sense urgency willingness to cooperate support larger general interest helped to carry us through difficult crisis period now less evident He to address problem important commercial banks to develop menu alternative new money options all banks debt exposure can choose providing continuing support debtor reforms He continued implementation debt strategy may well rest on their doing so Baker also growth prospects lowest income countries remain issue critical concern to United States He he intended to address problem poor country prospects greater detail at tomorrow s meeting joint IMF World Bank Devlopment Committee Baker however ministers should guard against what appear to be magical solutions to complex debt problem I want to stress need all to guard against ephemeral attraction magical solutions may appear as tantalizing alternatives to rigorous realities grappling our debt problems he But he emphasized only lasting progress to approach each situation on case by case basis bringing to bear policies financing needed to bring economy back to sustained economic growth

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute u f BC ANALYSTS DOUBT FED FI

text.title: ANALYSTS DOUBT FED FIRMED DESPITE BORROWING RISE
text.author: By Martin Cherrin Reuters
text.body: Economists they doubt Federal Reserve firming policy to aid dollar despite higher discount window borrowings latest two week statement period very heavy borrowings Wednesday Data out today show net borrowings Fed averaged dlrs two weeks to Wednesday up dlrs prior statement period Wednesday borrowings were billion dlrs as Federal funds averaged high pct One could make case Fed firming but probably isn t William Sullivan Dean Witter Reynolds Sullivan some may assume Fed firmed policy modestly to support dollar because net borrowings two weeks to Wednesday were nearly dlrs after averaging around dlrs over previous two months However Dean Witter economist noted latest two week period included quarter end when seasonal demand often pushes up borrrowings Some might argue Fed firming policy but looks like tried to play catchup reserve provisions late statement period didn t quite make Ward McCarthy Merrill Lynch Capital Markets Fed spokesman told press press conference today Fed no large net one day miss two billion dlrs or more reserve projections week ended Wednesday Still McCarthy may cumulative miss estimates over week caused to add fewer reserves earlier week than were actually needed Fed took no market reserve management action Thursday Friday first two days week added temporary reserves indirectly on Monday via two billion dlrs customer repurchase agreements then supplied reserves directly via System repurchases on Tuesday Wednesday Based on Fed data out today economists calculated two day System repurchase agreements Fed arrranged on Tuesday totaled around billion dlrs They put Wednesday s overnight System repos at approximately billion dlrs It quite clear Fed firming policy at time Larry Leuzzi S G Warburg Co Inc Citing view shared by other two economists Leuzzi Fed cannot really afford to seriously lift interest rates to help dollar because harm already weak economies United States abroad add to financial stress developing countries their lenders Those who believe Fed tightened policy latest statement period to explain why acted before dollar tumbled McCarthy Merrill Lynch He dollar staged precipitous drop as new statement period began today on disappointment yesterday s Washington meetings international monetary officials failed to produce anything offer substantive dollar aid fact currency dealers there nothing Wednesday s G communique to alter prevailing view yen needs to rise further to redress huge trade imbalance between United States Japan economists generally agreed Fed aiming steady policy now reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC U S MARKETS OFFER GL

text.title: U S MARKETS OFFER GLIMPSE OF VOLCKER NIGHTMARE
text.author: By Alan Wheatley Reuters
text.body: Today s turmoil U S Financial markets bond stock prices tumbling dollar s wake evidence major shift investor psychology likely to spell more turbulence ahead economists two years markets hailed dollar s decline as cure all U S Trade deficit Interest rates fell sharply Wall Street became one way street up But confidence now cracking as financial markets suddenly believe Fed chairman Paul Volcker s often repeated warnings risks dollar collapse Volcker s been saying long time dollar freefall be extremely dangerous now he s got David Jones economist at Aubrey G Lanston Co Inc dollar fell below yen today first time years as Group Seven finance ministers Washington failed to convince foreign exchange market they credible strategy redressing global trade imbalances short further depreciation dollar Bonds suffered their biggest one day drop months amid worries dollar s slide rekindle inflation scare away foreign investors force Fed to tighten credit inflationary fears boosted gold bullion by more than dlrs to high dlrs ounce while spike interest rates pulled Dow Jones Industrial Average down by points to Norman Robertson Mellon Bank chief economist called markets instability frightening He believes economic fundamentals do justify bearishness but once you start ball rolling s difficult to stop There s stark possibility you could get destabilizing drop dollar forces up interest rates drives us into recession markets panic Stephen Marris Institute International Economics Washington been warning long time controlled decline dollar since peaks marks yen February could turn into nightmare We re still more or less on track hard landing But agony may be fairly drawn out Marris told Reuters Marris does expect crisis to peak until later year but he warned situation so fragile take very little to touch off what he calls second phase hard landing whereby loss confidence dollar pushes up interest rates leads to recession stock market s reaction today sharp drop on March shows how loss confidence could come fact happened yet consistent historical experience teaches domestic markets affected until currency final stages decline Marris He forecast drop to yen Marris felt major impetus dollar s latest weakness loss credibility central banks suffered when they failed to prevent dollar falling below yen floor market believes set as part G Paris agreement February Robertson at Mellon by contrast loss confidence triggered week when Washington announced plans to slap dlrs tariffs on Japanese electronic imports raising specter debilitating trade war Many economists believe long run stability return to markets until root cause trade gap addressed excessive consumption U S Reflected massive budget deficit But short term given failure G central bank intervention some feel Fed no choice but to tighten credit to restore faith dollar The only thing stop dollar falling substantial increase discount rate corresponding cut abroad at least by Japan Lanston s Jones Marris expects Fed to act quickly to raise interest rates even at risk increasing debt burden American farmers Latin American governments others But Robert Giordano chief economist at Goldman Sachs Co scoffed at notion It s ridiculous to think Federal Reserve raise interest rates when dollar weak against just one currency yen strength dollar weakness he Giordano market ignoring progress being made toward reducing U S Budget deficit We re going to one biggest reductions budget deficit relative to GNP history year nobody cares he noting only deficit cut been greater He he does expect dollar to collapse thinks interest rates likely to fall back later year But now market psychology changed so abruptly further drop bond market cannot be ruled out Put on your helmets Giordano

text.author: By Julie Vorman Reuters
text.body: Texaco Inc TX decision to file protection under Chapter U S Bankruptcy code affect majority businesses subsidiaries account pct billion dlrs revenues pct net property plant equipment were free action Only parent holding company Texaco Inc operating subsidiaries Texaco Capital Inc Texaco Capital N V affected But company likely to suspend cents per share quarterly common stock dividend halt repayments on debts some billion dlrs Texaco filed Chaper because suppliers were demanding cash payments banks were withholding loans as result legal dispute Pennzoil Co PZL Texaco fighting Texas law requiring to post bond more than billion dlrs before can appeal judgment ruled illegally interfered Pennzoil s acquisition Getty Petroleum Corp GTY bond almost matches damages awarded against Texaco Should Texaco fail to place bond Pennzoil could begin to attach assets to secure judgment Monday Supreme Court overturned decision to cut Texaco s bond to one billion dlrs sent issue back to Texas courts Analysts bankruptcy filing effectively froze all Texaco s obligations while continued to appeal merits Pennzoil lawsuit Attempts week to win compromise on both bond issue larger dispute failed James Kinnear Texaco s president chief executive officer told reporters Kinnear Pennzoil s disclosure court papers on Friday wanted to extend bond issue hearing until end April pushed Texaco further towards Chapter Pennzoil asked Texaco to post billion dlr cash bond to reduce dividend to more than pct earnings Pennzoil also wanted assurances Texaco sell any assets Kinnear Texaco offered to put up one billion dlrs letter credit agreed to let value assets fall under billion dlrs he added Joseph Jamail Houston attorney Pennzoil company made latest settlement offer to Texaco on Saturday taken by surprise when Texaco filed bankruptcy He declined to reveal amount proposal citing confidentiality agreement between two companies Texaco told us they get back to us but instead they chose to go to bankruptcy court Jamail Attorneys Pennzoil they believed company prevail court appeals adding Texaco s assets were ample ultimately to pay Pennzoil judgment full

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC GERMAN CAPITAL MARKET

text.title: GERMAN CAPITAL MARKET LIBERALIZATION STALLS
text.author: By Alice Ratcliffe Reuters
text.body: West Germany s capital market liberalization program stalled bankers worried may take years further reforms to be completed Liberalization got underway May when foreign banks received Bundesbank permission to lead manage mark eurobonds Further moves included introduction mark denominated certificates deposit year But other changes including revisions domestic options market introduction futures contracts need lengthy statutory changes may take years bankers dealers say Deutsche Bank AG co chairman F Wilhelm Christians called week enlargement current capital market instruments to include instruments already standard abroad He these needed especially when prices fall citing declines West German share prices first two months year when stock indices fell pct Others more blunt Securities dealers say lack viable hedging instruments shares bonds makes trading domestic markets too risky We need stock index futures contract futures contract recent government bonds one dealer West Germany now options contracts on five pct shares bonds traded on exchanges here covering only pct average traded volume stock market sources Options can only be written on original bonds selected when bond options were introduced April most recent bond on list issued There no futures exchanges West Germany German banks may participate futures exchanges through branches abroad but these at least outwardly subject to stringent West German rules requiring every contract be secured on one by one basis separate hedge to prevent speculation Another problem lack liquidity existing markets owing to lack private investor participation Private individuals corporations do engage options trading now due to West Germany s civil exchange laws define losses made futures options business as gambling losses investors need pay back Options business been hurt by lack liquidity pension funds currently forbidden to invest these instruments But they to be allowed to enter business soon as European Community begins to harmonize rules governing funds Manfred Laux general secretary West German mutual funds association Frankfurt harmonized rules to be adopted by October at latest push to adopt new instruments been great past owing to wide spread belief they speculative gives them bad name West Germany But pressure their introduction here growing start up Swiss futures exchange some bankers considering if similar exchange be useful West Germany They say without innovations some business could drift to London Bundesbank vehemently opposes official at London International Financial Futures Exchange LIFFE exchange currently no plans to introduce more mark denominated contracts beyond existing mark dollar contract But he exchange studying feasibility other contracts including one three month mark interest rates possibly government bond contract Bundesbank capital markets expert Bundesbank no objections to hedging through futures but any liberalization sector still early planning stages after earlier talks ended two years ago Considerations futures business been drawn out because large number participants involved talks They include parliament Bundesbank Federal Banking Supervisory Board eight West German stock exchanges their governing states four West German banking associations Beyond options futures other changes being suggested include replacing federal government s current bond consortium auction procedure similar to one being considered U K already practice U S upset existing market order providing German foreign banks consortium fixed quotas but eliminate misallocations some bankers say presently arise within fixed consortium quota system addition some bankers like method bond trading on West German stock exchange changed to system continuous price setting current system every bond price fixed once day make trading more transparent if reduced proportion off floor interbank bond trading now some pct volume bond transactions here bankers say

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC OFFER FOR DOME MAY SH

text.title: OFFER FOR DOME MAY SHORT CIRCUIT ITS DEBT TALKS
text.author: By Larry Welsh Reuters
text.body: A billion dlr offer Dome Petroleum Ltd DMP MO by TransCanada Pipelines Ltd TRP TO may short circuit Dome s restructuring plan open door more takeover bids oil analysts Dome trying to get approval plan to refinance debt more than billion dlrs by July when interim debt plan allowed Canadian oil gas firm to defer substantial payments to creditors expire Analysts TransCanada s bid signals Dome s debtholders alternative exists to Dome s debt plan Dome announced plan to major creditors as well as public noteholders March after several months delicate negotiations TransCanada s proposal amounts to quasi debt restructuring oil analyst Doug Gowland Brown Baldwin Nisker Ltd Toronto Calgary based Dome s restructuring plan allow creditors to convert debt to common shares under formula yet to be negotiated Payments on remaining debt be linked to cash flow generated by assets pledged against debt The weakness whole debt refinancing proposal even approval creditors there no assurance Dome fact be able to repay all debt obligations Wilf Gobert oil analyst Peters Co Ltd Calgary TransCanada s announcement came as surprise since Dome waiting responses creditors on proposed refinancing packages Gobert TransCanada proposal could open bidding Dome since other potential buyers were probably waiting lenders to agree to restructuring he added I think debtholders want to entertain any all offers for Dome Gobert Dome spokesman David Annesley New York TransCanada s announcement could be seen as attempt to fix bidding price Dome effort to preclude other possible buyers making offer By drawing attention to us our discussions means others may be little reluctant to come forward he Dome does consider TransCanada s proposal formal offer because pipeline utility s announcement breached confidential agreement between two companies he Dome responded to statement by suspending discussions TransCanada order to pursue talks other unidentified parties However Dome management financial advisers evaluate all proposals including TransCanada s Gowland TransCanada s offer probably fair price company s acres oil gas land holdings However he enough financial details known Dome s debt restructuring to compare value TransCanada s proposed offer

text.title: TRADE ISSUES STRAINING EC S PATIENCE WITH JAPAN
text.author: By Gerrard Raven Reuters
text.body: Member states European Community starting to run out patience Japan they believe repeatedly promised major initiatives to open market to imports but as often made only minor moves Diplomatic sources here several recent actions by EC countries bear witness to new disillusionment willingness or at least ability Japanese government to reduce massive trade surplus EC However they all out trade war may be far off as EC states know they suffer almost as much as Japan Senior EC diplomats gave generally favourable reaction to EC executive commission proposal under EC could raise text.title: EURO MEDIUM TERM NOTES POISED FOR GROWTH
text.author: By Marguerite Nugent Reuters
text.body: Euro medium term notes recent phenomenon international capital markets hardly attracting flood issuers but investment bankers doing their best to breath life into market Medium term notes MTNs met staggering success U S Market where total outstandings grown to around billion dlrs since year they took hold as new financing vehicle to bridge gap between commercial paper longer term bonds Convinced they here to stay investment bankers attempting to adapt MTNs euromarket Ralph Bunche vice president Morgan Stanley International predicted at recent Euromoney conference on MTNs here they become predominant instrument raising funds late s s It the MTN market even surpass bond market he Other bankers took exception degree to MTNs grow But they generally agreed these instruments provide borrower greater flexibility lower costs than traditional bond trick convincing European borrowers worth arranging program having accomplished to persaude European investors whose preferences differ their U S Counterparts to buy securities Discussions bankers proved one thing No one exactly sure how to proceed structuring marketing these issues To date only Euro MTN programs been announced but only few been activated such as those unit PepsiCo Inc another AB Electrolux Several firms devised different structures Euro MTNs defend their structures adamantly PepsiCo notes example sold on continuously offered basis involves small amount new notes similar maturities constantly on offer at current market rates Electrolux program uses multi tranche tap notes devised by Merrill Lynch Under structure initial tranche minimum dlrs fixed rate interest maturity borrower then issues additional notes category up to pre determined maximum Those who defend continuously offered method such as Wendy Dietze Salomon Brothers Inc vice president point to flexibility they offer interest rate maturity Furthermore she believes structure offers European investor greater confidence market liquidity major concern these buyers Merrill Lynch Europe Ltd s Kevin Regan defends medium tranche tap notes concept saying offers comparable liquidity But he also structure may be right option all borrowers Peter Mortimer partner law firm Milbank Tweed Hadley McCloy noted legal requirements could well determine structure chosen He noted tap system allows more clearly defined lock up period as each tranche specific maturity case notes issued by U S Borrowers lock up period days after completion series during time security cannot be sold back to U S Or to U S Investors However he Securities Exchange Commission reviewing current regulations on ownership foreign securities by U S Citizens some softening rules could come too distant future their part borrowers say they feel bit like guinea pigs Petter Skouen executive vice president Nordic Investment Bank NIB noted few weeks ago NIB disappointed Euro MTN program but success recent issue changed their minds He conceded retrospect been wiser to establish separate programs euromarket U S Domestic market rather than try to extend U S Issue globally Under NIB s dlr program been sold U S Europe

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC ELECTION RESULT MAY D

text.title: ELECTION RESULT MAY DELAY JAPAN ECONOMIC STIMULUS
text.author: By Kunio Inoue Reuters
text.body: The ruling Liberal Democratic Party s LDP setback Sunday s nationwide local elections may force government to water down controversial proposal five pct sales tax undermine commitment to stimulating economy private economists LDP s failure to win seats some crucial local constituencies weaken government s ability to push through tax plan without compromise tax proposal budget fiscal ending March unlikely to be passed soon they Without budget government also be hard pressed to come up effective package to stimulate economy as pledged at Group Seven meetings Paris late February Washington week they Opposition protests against sales tax stalled parliamentary debate on budget weeks forced government to enact stop gap budget began early month The LDP s election setback enormous impact on already faltering economy Johsen Takahashi chief economist at Mitsubishi Research Institute Takahashi behind LDP s poor showing public discontent government s high handed push tax reform lack effective policies to cope economic woes caused by yen s appreciation This explains why LDP failed to regain governorships most hotly contested constituencies Fukuoka Hokkaido where shipbuilding steel industries suffering heavily yen s extended rise he Takahashi government should delay introduction sales tax one or two years beyond original starting date January implement tax cuts now Sumitomo Bank Ltd chief economist Masahiko Koido also he favours watering down proposed sales tax while suggesting government boost public works spending by modifying tight fiscal policies The local election results were signal economy now needs government action to take clear cut fiscal measures he adding such moves help world economy as well as Japan s five years or so government stuck to tight fiscal policy bid to halt issue deficit financing bonds by fiscal economists If LDP election setback leads to scaled down sales tax proposal government to find other revenue sources to help finance planned tax cuts package measures to stimulate economy economists Koido government could raise additional revenue by selling shares public corporations such as Nippon Telegraph Telephone Corp But should issue additional bonds to ensure more stable source funds he It may run counter to avowed policy balancing budget but can do so on short term basis he Takahashi Mitsubishi Research also agreed need government to float more bonds to raise funds needed economic expansion He additional government borrowing place no burden on capital market because amassed huge excess funds government bond prices risen to record levels lately The market just waiting more new government bond issues he

text.body: Eurobonds Texaco Inc subsidiaries were unquoted morning as traders assessed implications company s shock weekend decision to file bankruptcy under Chapter U S Bankruptcy laws eurobond dealers decision to file bankruptcy follows court decision to post billion dlr bond to continue court battles Pennzoil Co PZL One head trader at U S Securities house I don t want to be obstructive but there genuinely no market Texaco bonds at moment Everyone stunned by decision to file bankruptcy can t really believe One dealer noted Texaco subsidiaries outstanding eurobonds totalling over three billion dlrs out total borrowings some billion dlrs He added many fixed interest eurobonds dollar straights been trading basis only some time prior to weekend s news means traders could quote two way price bonds but be bound to trade them Any trades be negotiated He recently there appeared to been some speculative buying bonds U S But European investors been overall sellers Dealers noted under Chapter filing noteholders receive no interest payments Texaco also eurobonds outstanding convertible into Texaco Inc common stock known as convertibles Trading did open these issues either One convertible dealer We re waiting to see result today s court hearing Texaco applying today Texas courts relief having to post court bond Texaco shares were being indicated by over counter share dealers here at around to dlrs compared Friday s close New York dlrs Pennzoil shares were indicated at to dlrs compared Friday s New York finish dlrs

Exports to Japan Japan s fault They cite restrictive trade practices protected Japanese trade sectors such as agriculture non tariff barriers such as unreasonable checking customs procedures car reuters.unknown: V f reute r f BC G SEEMS WORRIED MAR

text.title: G SEEMS WORRIED MARKETS IGNORE COORDINATION
text.author: By Peter Torday Reuters
text.body: Top officials leading industrial nations appear deeply worried financial markets ignored their efforts to coordinate policies they believe they strengthened talks week Monetary sources officials were exasperated markets drove dollar rapidly lower severely disrupted bond stock markets too did take heed policy commitments Group Seven United States Japan West Germany France Britain Italy Canada Treasury Secretary James Baker went out his way to reassure markets his commitment to stable dollar statement French Finance Minister Edouard Balladur underscored by saying I don t believe at all Americans want weaker dollar West German Finance Minister Gerhard Stoltenberg dollar s latest rapid descent involves risk now already tangible threat new strong surge inflation leading to renewed rise interest rates But there were signs too while policymakers feared market uproar they seemed to accept there little they could do until economic picture changed currencies settled into stable pattern as result Nor did there seem to be any enthusiasm at week s semi annual meetings IMF World Bank higher U S Interest rates as best way to curb dollar s rapid descent distaste stems part fears recession Outgoing Deputy Treasury Secretary Richard Darman told television interviewers he did think policy driving dollar down solve U S trade deficit It slow growth Germany Japan adversely affect our trade balance ultimately drive interest rates up here throw us if into recession into slower growth he Asked if higher U S Interest rates stabilize dollar Balladur When currency maintained artificially high by artificially high interest rates healthy resorting to higher interest rates could lead to recession he Acknowledging dollar s latest slide now fact life Balladur there may be adjustments course one or other currencies fixed rate system But Federal Reserve Board chairman Paul Volcker he might rein credit if dollar s slide deepens U S Monetary sources also Washington wanted understood by markets seven s commitments were genuine The United States six major industrial countries fully committed to implementing our undertakings these agreements Baker told meetings Darman Baker been misinterpreted by markets wrongly believed earlier remarks suggested he wanted further decline dollar Baker Darman committed to stabilizing currencies at current levels week s statement seven reaffirmed February agreement Paris Reagan administration agreed to reach budget deficit compromise Congress to fight protectionism West Germany Japan meanwhile agreed to stimulate domestic demand lead global upturn Ministers believed Paris pact bolstered by Japan s promise billion dlr supplementary budget sources they believed Baker saw as major action But seven seem to accept their commitment to stable currencies applied to today s exchange rates those at time Paris agreement when dollar stood higher Paris accord currencies are within ranges broadly consistent underlying economic fundamentals given policy commitments summarized statement Now they accept dollar s lower level especially against yen as hard reality nonetheless consistent agreement The ministers governors reaffirmed view around current levels their currencies within ranges broadly consistent fundamentals week s statement read Monetary sources policymakers understood markets were focusing on instability created by gap between U S Trade deficit surpluses West Germany Japan rather than prospective policy changes European monetary sources Bonn still unconvinced Washington meant business commitment to cut budget deficit

reuters.unknown: E F f reute u f BC OFFER FOR DOME MAY SH

text.title: OFFER FOR DOME MAY SHORT CIRCUIT ITS DEBT TALKS
text.author: By Larry Welsh Reuters
text.body: A billion dlr offer Dome Petroleum Ltd DMP MO by TransCanada Pipelines Ltd TRP TO may short circuit Dome s restructuring plan open door more takeover bids oil analysts Dome trying to get approval plan to refinance debt more than billion dlrs by July when interim debt plan allowed Canadian oil gas firm to defer substantial payments to creditors expire Analysts TransCanada s bid signals Dome s debtholders alternative exists to Dome s debt plan Dome announced plan to major creditors as well as public noteholders March after several months delicate negotiations TransCanada s proposal amounts to quasi debt restructuring oil analyst Doug Gowland Brown Baldwin Nisker Ltd Toronto Calgary based Dome s restructuring plan allow creditors to convert debt to common shares under formula yet to be negotiated Payments on remaining debt be linked to cash flow generated by assets pledged against debt The weakness whole debt refinancing proposal even approval creditors there no assurance Dome fact be able to repay all debt obligations Wilf Gobert oil analyst Peters Co Ltd Calgary TransCanada s announcement came as surprise since Dome waiting responses creditors on proposed refinancing packages Gobert TransCanada proposal could open bidding Dome since other potential buyers were probably waiting lenders to agree to restructuring he added I think debtholders want to entertain any all s demand return to guaranteed percentage annual pay increases were dropped recession Ford been hit by national strike since prompted some union analysts to suggest now Ford s turn to be UAW strike reuters.unknown: RM f reute r f BC PORTUGUESE ECONOMY RE

text.title: PORTUGUESE ECONOMY REMAINS BUOYANT DESPITE CRISIS
text.author: By Pascal Fletcher Reuters
text.body: Portugal s economy been enjoying one most buoyant periods more than decade may now be strong enough to shrug off country s latest government crisis analysts But April ousting Prime Minister Anibal Cavaco Silva s government could slow economic reforms investment as Portugal continues to adapt to membership European Community joined January year they Cavaco Silva s minority Social Democratic Party PSD toppled parliamentary censure vote by left wing parties centre right administration made economic growth reform priority months office Portugal s economy grew four pct current account surplus swelled to more than one billion dlrs inflation fell to pct pct Analysts businessmen prospects instability were worrying but they felt foundations continued growth been badly shaken The economy developed certain self confidence now less dependent on political situation Fritz Haser economics professor at Universidade Livre Lisbon The market doesn t see as real crisis yet economist Jorge Braga de Macedo told Reuters Businessmen identified political instability over years as one biggest obstacles to lasting economic progress PSD administration th formed since revolution Portugal s developing stock markets however remain buoyant Brokers unit trust managers recent surge economic confidence under PSD rule still largely underpinned by continuing optimistic forecasts Investment grew nearly pct Bank Portugal forecast released on day PSD government fell predicted pace investment overall economic growth remain at similar levels year But analysts crisis interrupted current policies could slow economic development Soares who expected to announce decision by end month can either call early elections or form new government parties existing left wing dominated parliament Many businessmen they strongly favoured quick elections as best solution There good chance majority government could result early elections Confederation Portuguese Industry CIP president Pedro Ferraz da Costa He they were optimistic could mean continuation near future liberalisation policies introduced over year left wing parties favour parliamentary solution but PSD wants early election opinion polls say they could win overall majority PSD majority also open way more wide ranging reforms such as relaxation labour laws possible denationalisation industry analysts Cavaco Silva accused left wing opposition parties blocking key economic reforms left wingers Portugal s positive economic results were more product favourable international conditions such as cheaper oil raw material imports than PSD policies

reuters.unknown: F Y f reute r f AM texaco analysis

text.title: TEXACO TX USES BANKRUPTCY COURT TO BUY TIME
text.author: By Julie Vorman Reuters
text.body: Texaco Inc s plunge into bankruptcy to shield posting bond billion dlr legal battle Pennzoil Co PZL strategy give breathing room until fight over acquisition Getty Oil Co winds way up to U S Supreme Court analysts Texaco nation s third largest oil company filed protection under Chapter U S bankruptcy code earlier today saying no choice because Pennzoil s refusal to negotiate reasonable settlement But unlike most Chapter cases Texaco proceeding should result major reorganization company or affect daily business operations several experts This another piece financial history Sanford Margoshes analyst Shearson Lehman Brothers bankruptcy filing What Texaco doing buying time to fight battle courts They high hopes they be upheld if case goes all way to U S Supreme Court Margoshes he did anticipate any significant changes Texaco s oil exploration production business because bankruptcy filing affects only four pct giant oil company s billion dlrs annual revenues Texaco executives bankruptcy filing effectively halt payments stock dividends repayment billion dlr debt but added company s assets far exceeded liabilities Texaco s cash flow at very respectable rate dlrs per share annually Margoshes Obviously point Chapter so much seeking protection creditors as seeking protection predator Pennzoil two companies been locked acrimonious struggle since Texas state court jury November ordered Texaco to pay Pennzoil billion dlrs improperly interfering Pennzoil s planned acquisition Getty Oil Co major setback Texaco week U S Supreme Court Texaco must abide by Texas state law requires posting bond full amount judgment while merits case were appealed Although Texas appeals court hearing scheduled Monday April on Texaco s motion to reduce amount bond required under state law Texaco elected to risk losing important court ruling could required to post more than billion dlrs collateral bankruptcy filing analysts effectively freezes all Texaco s obligations while continues to appeal merits Pennzoil lawsuit This drastic measure Rosario Ilacqua analyst L F Rothschild New York But s also indictment legal system country Texaco forced to seek bankruptcy when couldn t get fair hearing Ilacqua predicted Texas jury judgment ultimately be overturned or whittled down original billion dlrs amount increasing by dlrs interest accumulated daily Texaco contested ruling insisting Pennzoil did valid contract under New York state law to acquire Getty Oil Suggestions by some experts Texaco bankruptcy might be incentive Pennzoil to lower settlement demands widely believed to be between billion billion dlrs were discounted by indignant Pennzoil executives I think makes much more difficult to settle Baine Kerr Pennzoil s retired president who acted as company s chief negotiator Texaco litigation I think s one main reasons they did Joseph Jamail Houston lawyer Pennzoil company made latest settlement offer to Texaco on Saturday taken by surprise when Texaco filed bankruptcy He declined to reveal amount proposal citing confidentiality agreement between two companies Texaco told us they get back to us but instead they chose to go to bankruptcy court Jamail This irresponsible unneeded move Ilacqua also bankruptcy filing appeared to eliminate any chance settlement near term There been some crazy numbers floating around settlement discussions Ilacqua I think billion dlr settlement be more than adequate Pennzoil I don t know if Texas jury really understood what money They gave Pennzoil astronomical judgment Analysts they expected Texaco stock closed Friday at to slip to when New York Stock Exchange opened Monday morning Lawyers Pennzoil they believed company prevail court appeals adding Texaco s assets were ample enough to ultimately pay Pennzoil judgment full

text.body: Four West Germany s five leading economic research institutes warned excessive monetary growth threatened resurgence inflation But dissenting view DIW institute West Berlin echoing recent statements by leading Bundesbank officials expansion seen over years did necessarily threaten stability five institutes issued joint spring report three Kiel Hamburg Essen forecast two pct rise GNP while West Berlin Munich predicted one pct four institutes expansive policy welcome view slowdown economic activity But experience shown strong monetary growth eventually leads to price rise undoes beneficial effects monetary policy Given virtual zero inflation West Germany such fears may seem exaggerated they But often turned out past price climate can quickly deteriorate forcing central bank into restrictive policy they economic costs preventive stability policy less than fighting inflation once taken hold they four institutes disputed view monetary expansion slow own accord as domestic investors switch liquidity into longer term capital market investments following lower interest rates Such redispositions may temporarily dampen expansion central bank money stock but do automatically lead to smaller expansion money supply they return to growth stability did require spectacular central bank moves but could be done quietly open market operations repurchase pacts avoid interest rate rise by dampening inflationary expectations DIW institute monetary policy should be focused simply on growth production potential Because uncertainty exchange rate developments economic weakness other factors should be taken into account Monetary policy should aim further interest rate cuts avoid rises to boost economy discourage revaluation speculation Recent strong monetary expansion threat itself to price stability inflation following strong money growth reflected other causes such as rising oil prices falling mark

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC SAUDI ARABIA LIBERALI

text.title: SAUDI ARABIA LIBERALISES BANKING SYSTEM
text.author: By Stephen Jukes Reuters
text.body: Saudi Arabia speeded up reform financial system package measures designed to boost economy open up Kingdom to lucrative world investment banking Bankers Saudi Arabia detect fundamental shift policy stemming need to tackle underlying contradiction between Islamic legal framework western banking system One senior banker Jeddah There new wind blowing Saudi Arabia moving on many fronts manner extraordinarily aggressive speed reform begun year but now gathering pace surprised bankers who to contend financial system restricted internationalisation riyal religious court system made debt collecting difficult Saudi banks once most profitable world generally reported falling profits fourth successive year decline as loan loss provisions ate into already dwindling earnings Bankers say Saudi Finance Ministry Saudi Arabian Monetary Agency SAMA seem to developed new strategy although remains to be seen how be implemented Reform started measures to boost previously dormant stock trading but took off earnest year January SAMA liberalised money market giving banks greater access to liquidity aid via repurchase agreements March Finance Ministry abolished withholding tax on funds borrowed by Saudi banks abroad same date banks were notified new committee to be set up under auspices SAMA to hear bank disputes creditors over non payment loans Also same date banks were allowed to use mortgages as collateral lending banned since Within few weeks Kingdom s first stock market trading floor expected to be opened Housed central Riyadh building Saudi Industrial Development Fund floor initially be used to trade shares on auction system Staff each commercial banks been trained ahead launch new computer network been set up One banker The abolition withholding tax give banks opportunity to participate new instruments such as interest rate or currency swaps At SAMA Finance Ministry opening up markets investment banking Bankers say Saudi authorities appear to been shocked into reform by pressure banks alarm at bank reluctance to extend further loans to private sector Banks lobbied hard change arguing religious or Sharia legal framework inconsistent Kingdom s western banking system made nigh impossible them to collect interest on bad loans through courts As result many banks virtually stopped new lending but found themselves cut off world investment banking by series restrictions Withholding tax made punitively expensive to take part interest rate or currency swaps private sector s frustration at virtual standstill bank lending overflowed at businessmen s conference mountain resort Abha month some powerful merchant families also called change bankers Banks lobbied hard ultimate weapon to force change they stopped lending another banker That stifling growth economy still unclear whether new committee be set up to hear bank disputes creditors prove any more efficient than another non Sharia system already force Committees Settlement Commercial Disputes CSCDs Some bankers believe new committee yet to be formed simply delay pending cases force banks into series private deals creditors Nor clear what stance new committee take on interest payments generally recognised under Islamic law But other bankers say move clear recognition by SAMA Finance Ministry Sharia courts CSCDs were correct bodies hearing bank disputes Other reforms been taken or pipeline Finance Minister Mohammed Ali Abal Khail March new body examine late government payments to contractors addition further moves under way to align business life to Gregorian calendar year companies being urged to adopt as their financial year black list borrowers started more than two years ago by banks recently been effectively sanctioned by SAMA bankers say Banks now permitted to lend or engage securities transactions any party on list

reuters.unknown: F RM Y V f reute b f BC PENNZOIL PZL TO CON

text.title: PENNZOIL PZL TO CONTEST TEXACO QTX BANKRUPTCY
text.body: Pennzoil Co lawyers they plan to file documents challenging Texaco Inc s Chapter bankruptcy proceedings Southern District New York John Jeffers Houston lawyer representing Pennzoil billion dlr dispute Texaco over acquisition Getty Oil Co he expected challenge to be filed sometime week We ll challenge as bad faith filing Jeffers told Reuters following brief hearing before Texas State Court Appeals court been scheduled to hear arguments on Texaco motion to reduce amount bond required to appeal judgement Instead court agreed Texaco lawyers issue moot because Texaco s bankruptcy petition filed yesterday stays all debts obligations We think they abused process Jeffers referring to Texaco s bankruptcy filing D J Baker lawyer representing Texaco told reporters nation s third largest oil company forced to seek bankruptcy protection because precarious fianncial condition problems suplliers bankers stemming billion dlr judgement All activity after filing can be conducted on normal business terms Baker He Texaco seek permission court to continue appeal Texas courts Pennzoil judgement There be no bond required because all state court litigation been stayed Baker When asked whether Texaco s reorganization plan include major restructuring company Baker declined to say what eventual plan might include I think Texaco succesfully complete Chapter proceedings reorganization plan approved by court he Baker Texaco expected Pennzoil to seek seat on creditors committee to be appointed by bankruptcy courts but added he did know whether Texaco oppose such attempt Lawyers both sides also each company continued to be interested possible settlement but declined to say whether any negotiations were scheduled between two companies Texaco tried to settle continue try settle Baker two companies reportedly remain far apart what each considers to be fair settlement Pennzoil seeking between three five billion dlrs while Texaco maintained cannot pay more than one billion dlrs according to analysts

text.body: Taiwan announced plans another round import tariff cuts on foreign goods shortly before trade talks Washington officials described as move to help balance trade United States Wang Der Hwa Deputy Director Finance Ministry s Customs Administration Department told reporters list products included items asked by Washington The move part our government efforts to encourage imports our trading partners particularly United States he He ministry sent proposal today to cabinet tariffs on such products as cosmetics bicycles apples radios garments soybeans television sets be cut by between five pct cabinet expected to give approval next Thursday new tariff cuts be implemented possibly starting on April he added Taiwan introduced sweeping tariff cut on some foreign products January aimed at helping reduce growing trade surplus United States island s largest trading partner Washington however satisfied cuts pressed more reductions as way cutting huge trade deficit Taipei Washington s deficit Taipei rose to record billion U S Dlrs year billion widened to billion first quarter billion year earlier Taiwan s official figures show Today s announcement came before departure later today member Taiwan delegation Washington series trade talks U S Officials delegation s leader Vincent Siew told reporters night he leaving a heavy heart meaning he face tough talks Washington because rising protectionist sentiments U S Congress Taiwan s trade surplus Washington third largest after Japan Canada Siew talks starting on April cover U S Calls Taiwan to open market to American products purchases major U S Machinery power plant equipment import tariff cuts protection intellectual property I am afraid time we to give more than take our talks U S he without elaborating

text.title: U S JUNK BONDS UNAFFECTED BY TEXACO TX FILING
text.author: By John Picinich Reuters
text.body: Despite sharp early fall Texaco Inc bonds billion dlr U S junk bond market largely unaffected by Texaco s weekend filing protection under Chapter Bankruptcy Code analysts Texaco s filing little if any effect on junk bond prices morning should spill over to overall market like LTV Corp s LTV bankruptcy filing did summer one analyst Traders some Texaco debt issues fell over points morning thin trading but recouped half Because Texaco filing some investors bid down paper to mid area around dlrs per dlr face value around Friday dealer high yield low rated bonds But sellers could be found at those levels bids soon rebounded to to area he added referring to such issues as Texaco s pct notes s s All were mid s Friday rebound occurred after Standard Poor s Corp downgraded debt ratings billion dlrs debt Texaco subsidiaries to D traders noted S P cited weekend bankruptcy filing agency uses D grade securities issued by companies Chapter reorganization Moody s Investors Service Inc followed suit cutting most debt Texaco units to Caa junk bond market experienced short lived downturn summer when LTV s bankruptcy filing sparked worries credit conditions other steel companies also worsen This clearly case Texaco one trader Because their high yields junk bonds lately outperformed investment grade corporates he others Analysts portfolio managers they viewed Texaco s bankruptcy filing as defensive move Indeed Texas State Court Appeal morning bankruptcy petition effectively stays Texaco s obligation under Texas law to post bond billion dlr litigation against Pennzoil Co PZL The filing result credit weakness company got through oil crisis alright one portfolio manager Others who run junk bond portfolios agreed assessment they still buy high yield issues

reuters.unknown: A f reute w f BC PRIMARY GILTS DEALERS

text.title: PRIMARY GILTS DEALERS NEED NOT BUY AT AUCTIONS
text.body: Primary dealers U K Government gilts be required to underwrite government s offering securities when first auctions begin Mid May Bank England official notice released today Bank There be no formal or informal underwriting arrangement auctions but Bank encourages all gilt edged market makers as part their commitment to market to participate actively auction process Bank originally believed to favoured requiring dealers to underwrite auctions patterned after those U S Treasury market However Treasury believed to baulked at request by market makers allotment commission discourage largest institutional investors placing orders new stock directly through Bank England thus denying primary dealers some their best customers Commission been passed along to customers who did place orders via primary dealers making less expensive to buy through them than to go directly to Bank Market sources Bank discussions dealers upcoming auctions agreed allotment commission reasonable if dealers concurrent commitment to buy at auction regardless market conditions Indeed Bank gilts dealers believed to be disappointed Treasury agreed to go along plan However paper Bank suggested any conditions applied first few auctions may be abandoned or modified future sales gilts if they prove inefficient or unwieldy Among other items document Bank first auction consist up to billion stg conventional short dated stock maturity seven years or less Subsequent auctions to be held financial year first be up to one billion stg long dated stock having maturity years or longer then up to one billion stg medium dated stock seven to years maturity remainder gilt edged funding program be met by traditional tap offerings stock via government broker To protect buyers newly auctioned stock Bank agreed to establish so called fallow period day period during agrees to issue any new stock same type necessarily resume selling stock once fallow period expires event prices offered stock to be sold substantially out line market conditions Bank agree to take stock onto own books bank then be free to sell stock during fallow period but at price below minimum tender price Bank also at least initially auctions be alloted on bid price basis system under bidders allotted stock at price they bid However Bank reserves right to limit any money market maker buying more than pct single auction Bank widely believed to be concerned preventing single market maker cornering stock to drive price up Bank repeatedly signalled intention to prevent dealers cornering market stock issuing additional stock on occasion to end market shortage Bank also agreed to publish information auction results as soon as possible after sale complete widely expected to be on same day Information to be released text.title: TALKING POINT IBM IBM
text.author: By Lawrence Edelman Reuters
text.body: International Business Machines Corp started year aggressively but industry analysts company still faces some tough rounds fight to stop two year earnings slump I am more impressed what s happening at IBM than I been long time PaineWebber analyst Stephen Smith But they re out woods yet he added At dlrs share IBM s first quarter net income easily topped most estimates on Wall Street ranged even dollar to dlrs Most analysts they were pleasantly surprised by IBM s performance But they indicated IBM s chances full recovery hinged on several key factors whose impact be felt until later year These include success IBM s new personal computer line introduced two weeks ago minicomputers begin volume shipments July addition IBM full benefits early retirement program other cost cutting moves emerge as year progresses Analysts noted IBM chairman John F Akers relatively more upbeat assessing company s outlook than he been nearly year Although worldwide economic situation remains unsettled there some encouraging signs our business Akers pointing to among other things higher first quarter shipments We remain optimistic prospects both industry IBM he Akers most encouraging PaineWebber s Smith weak dollar lower tax rate strong mainframe computer sales all contributed to better than expected first quarter results analysts Shipments mainframes were very strong March after weak January February Ulric Weil Washington based Weil Associates Sales top of the line mainframes commonly called Sierras bailed out whole quarter Weil adding If continues augers well rest year M

text.title: ELECTION RESULT MAY DELAY JAPAN ECONOMIC STIMULUS
text.author: By Kunio Inoue Reuters
text.body: The ruling Liberal Democratic Party s LDP setback Sunday s nationwide local elections may force government to water down controversial proposal five pct sales tax undermine commitment to stimulating economy private economists LDP s failure to win seats some crucial local constituencies weaken government s ability to push through tax plan without compromise tax proposal budget fiscal ending March unlikely to be passed soon they Without budget government also be hard pressed to come up effective package to stimulate economy as pledged at Group Seven meetings Paris late February Washington week they Opposition protests against sales tax stalled parliamentary debate on budget weeks forced government to enact stop gap budget began early month The LDP s election setback enormous impact on already faltering economy Johsen Takahashi chief economist at Mitsubishi Research Institute Takahashi behind LDP s poor showing public discontent government s high handed push tax reform lack effective policies to cope economic woes caused by yen s appreciation This explains why LDP failed to regain governorships most hotly contested constituencies Fukuoka Hokkaido where shipbuilding steel industries suffering heavily yen s extended rise he Takahashi government should delay introduction sales tax one or two years beyond original starting date January implement tax cuts now

text.title: TECHNOLOGY COMPETITION FOR SATELLITE
text.author: By Catherine Arnst Reuters
text.body: Some United States largest aerospace firms competing some world s most powerful nations chance to cash on coming commercialization space newest space race contracts to launch privately owned satellites into orbit business expected to be worth two billion to five billion dlrs annually few years growing opportunities to make money space be highlighted month when U S National Oceanic Atmospheric Administration seeks lucrative commercial bids to lauch future weather satellites ending long standing dependence on National Aeronautics Space Administration Companies countries established satellite launching operations may also get jump on eventually providing other space based services particularly if proposed international manned space station launched as planned early s billion dlr space station first proposed by President Reagan could require as many as cargo deliveries year many delivered by private firms partners space station currently slated to be Canada Japan nation European Space Agency latter two also or developing their own commercial space programs Until Challenger explosion January NASA virtual lock on world s commercial space cargo But after re evaluation shuttle program President Reagan declared August future U S shuttle flights no longer carry commercial payloads administration s decision left Arianespace French led European consortium only option available to satellite owners concern quickly sold out all planned flights through company also raised prices dlrs launch to dlrs but even larger price tag did dampen demand Arianespace sighned new contracts year compared Those kind tariffs caused even non capitalist countries to try get piece action China Soviet Union Japan all announced satellite launch programs several U S firms including McDonnell Douglas Corp General Dynamics Corp Martin Marietta promised to spend mlns dollars over next three years to develop their own satellite launch capabilities There be some tremendous pent up demand satellite launches by then analysts Without Challenger there were only three satellite launches year fewer than lowest since when only two were sent up Ariane expects to launch six to eight satellites year next three years pct world s satellite launches during period McDonnell Douglas scored biggest coup U S firms January when won dlr U S Air Force pact up to unmanned rockets to launch military satellites contract expected to underwrite company s efforts to build rockets private satellite launches Martin Marietta however first U S company to sign up client Federal Express Co Marietta plans to launch ExpressStar communications satellite Marietta also build version Titan rockets used by Air Force to other private companies want to get into satellite launch buisiness Arianespace director Charles Bigot U S companies probably become European firm s biggest competitors satellite launching He does expect national space programs to become commercially viable until late s Japan expanded space program launching government owned satellites years But most them were small only February launched first satellite circles earth over poles Japan also yet to design build own rockets satellite launched February placed orbit by McDonnell Douglas designed Delta rocket assembled by Japanese under license Tsugo Tadakawa director Washington office Japan s National Space Development Agency NASDA Japan plans to launch seven H rockets American Japanese hybrid replaces Delta through much larger sucessor H II should be ready by he NASDA s annual budget only dlrs Tadakawa pct size NASA s yearly spending Still NASDA free private competition at home full support government since aerospace chosen by Ministry Trade Information as one country s new industries next decade Surprisingly People s Republic China relative newcomer to aerospace so far most successful competitor to Ariane country s Great Wall Industry Corp only national program besides European consortium to win private satellite contract launch Westar communications satellite New York based Terasat

reuters.unknown: C G L f reute r f BC EC MEAT DIRECTIVE DEA

text.title: EC MEAT DIRECTIVE DEADLINE SEEN FLEXIBLE
text.body: U S officials they held out little hope European Community EC withdraw controversial meat inspection requirement due to go into effect April U S meat producers claim cut off their exports But officials they expect EC to allow U S plants to continue shipping meat through end year provided they submit plant improvement program U S Agriculture Department EC s so called Third Country Meat Directive require foreign meat processing plants to comply fully EC inspection standards beginning April U S meat industry prepared petition requesting Reagan administration to retaliate against EC rule At issue U S meat exports to EC valued at dlrs EC rule require all U S plants to make changes their inspection methods ranging veterinary staffing to use wood December EC determined only one U S cattle one hog one sheep slaughtering facility could be approved without further review USDA to certify plants corrected deficiencies All remaining plants history or potential shipping to EC totaling nearly require more significant changes plant constructions or procedures before further EC review Robert Hibbert general counsel American Meat Institute meat industry expected to submit formal trade retaliation petition by April interagency committee reviewing industry s draft petition official at U S Trade Representative s Office U S officials continued to press EC to withdraw rule but the chances too good at time However there expectation U S government meat industry circles EC continue to allow shipments at least through end calendar year U S plants submit to USDA plan on how they bring their operations into conformity EC regulation USTR official

reuters.unknown: RM A f reute r f BC U S BANKS LIKELY TO

text.title: U S BANKS LIKELY TO LIFT PRIME RATES AGAIN SOON
text.author: By Martin Cherrin Reuters
text.body: Major U S banks may lift prime lending rates again within days due to recent increases their borrowing costs speculation Federal Reserve nudging up interest rates to help dollar economists what first prime rate boost since mid most banks early April lifted their rates quarter point to pct citing reduced gap between prime their own cost money spread narrowed again A prime rate increase could happen as soon as tonight Robert Brusca Nikko Securities Co International Inc Brusca quarter point prime rate rise to eight pct justified because spread between banks cost funds prime rate narrowed to less than three quarters percentage point He spread averaged around percentage points since October until fell below one point triggered April prime rate rise at most banks We could easily another prime rate increase as soon as week David Jones Aubrey G Lanston Co We ve got fairly good chance prime rate rise near future Allan Leslie Discount Corp Based on spread between prime rate funding costs you ordinarily see prime rate increase now Harold Nathan economist at Wells Fargo Bank However he banks may be reluctant to lift prime because dampen already fairly weak business loan demand because some sure Fed maintain recent upward pressure on money market interest rates Nathan believes Fed let market pressures lift short term rates recent days to help ailing dollar He if there widespread belief money market rates stay high prime rate rise could occur at any time Fed officials long expressed concern too steep dollar drop could help rekindle U S inflation As dollar fell to year low against yen Friday currency traders Fed other central banks supported dollar addition to buying dollars outright another way to stabilize U S currency be Fed to push U S interest rates higher relative to overseas rates Based particularly on Fed s reserve management actions on Friday today Nathan Wells Fargo it become clear Fed fully resisting upward rate pressure market supplying fewer reserves than needed Bank funding costs other short long term interest rates rose sharply Friday today on heightened speculation Fed gently firming monetary policy because Fed supplied far fewer reserves market than most economists expected On Friday Fed added reserves indirectly small amounts via one billion dlrs customer repurchase agreements Federal funds rate at banks lend to one another high at pct funds trading even higher at pct today Fed arranged only slightly larger billion dlr round customer repurchase agreements The Fed s actions on Friday today show offering only token resistance to upward funds rate pressures Jones Lanston The Fed focusing policy attention mainly on need to defend dollar Jones He believes merely shading policy toward restraint now but to major impact on dollar Fed to tighten policy overtly at some point Jones expects Fed to foster higher market rates by becoming more restrictive supplying reserves within four to six weeks to raise discount rate pct Jones U S discount rate increase to six pct might well be accompanied by West German Japanese rate cuts to further aid dollar Given likely Fed policy firming he both yield on year Treasury bonds about pct now prime rate may be at pct at end June nine pct by year s end The jury still out on whether Fed tightening policy to defend dollar Leslie Discount Corp He tax date pressures been pushing up Fed funds lately Leslie Fed actions reserve data once these pressures abate show whether or firming policy

text.title: PENNZOIL PZL PLOTS STRATEGY TO FIGHT TEXACO
text.author: By JULIE VORMAN Reuters
text.body: Pennzoil Co frustrated by Texaco Inc s TX decision to seek bankruptcy protection billion dlr court judgment preparing to launch new assault may include investigating assets Texaco transferred corporate parent to subsidiaries legal experts Joe Jamail Houston lawyer Pennzoil company file challenge to Texaco s bankruptcy petition sometime week accusing oil giant bad faith ignoring fiduciary responsibilities to shareholders action almost certain to ignite new round debate between two companies stemming Texaco s acquisition Getty Oil Co billion dlrs company Pennzoil believed agreement to buy We re going to be doing lot things they may like Jamail referring to bankruptcy court proceeding New York Some legal experts suggested mud slinging battle bankruptcy court between two companies might also provoke Congressional interest whether bankruptcy code too lenient because permits profitable firm to freeze debts Texaco assets totaling billion dlrs sought protection Sunday under Chapter federal bankruptcy code rather than risk having Texas appeals court order company to post security bond entire amount Pennzoil judgment Gerald Treece dean South Texas College Law observer litigation during past three years Pennzoil unlikely to prove Texaco qualified to be bankruptcy court simply because giant oil company positive cash flow assets far exceed liabilities But Pennzoil may be successful raising issue whether Texaco improperly transferred certain assets corporate parent into subsidiaries unaffected by bankruptcy filing Treece Pennzoil s lawyers going to be like dogs barking at heels Texaco wherever they go Treece I think people going to be surprised at level intensity Pennzoil use searching hidden Texaco assets Jamail Pennzoil objected to Texaco s transfer oil refinery chemical plant Port Arthur Texas corporate parent to subsidiary on Dec one day before state court judge entered record jury award against Texaco Jamail suggested refinery chemical plant valued at billion dlrs were deliberately placed out reach Texas jury judgment But Richard Lieb attorney Kronish Lieb Weiner Hellman New York Texaco could elect to place additional subsidiaries into bankruptcy if necessary petition filed Sunday only Texaco Inc corporate parent two financial subsidiaries were included bankruptcy case businesses account only four pct Texaco s total revenues Mickey Sheinfeld Houston lawyer who represented Continental Airlines historic bankruptcy case set aside labor union agreements track record bitter Texaco Pennzoil struggle indicates two companies could spend two or three years fighting bankruptcy court The courts been very interested issue good faith bankruptcy filings may prove to be landmark case developing issue Sheinfeld Texaco he following example set by Manville Corp H Robins Co other firms fell into bankruptcy expressly to avoid paying large legal judgments Bankruptcy laws were relaxed so company no longer needed to prove insolvent order to seek protection creditors Texaco lawyers bristle at suggestion company entered bankruptcy to spite Pennzoil Gibson Gayle Texaco lawyer company every right to seek protection creditors Texaco embarked on internal restructuring plan December required transferring various assets among subsidiaries But Treece high profile Texaco bankruptcy case may also put company under uncomfortable spotlight What seems fair what may be legally correct may be two entirely different things Treece This may be signal to Congress to do something tightening bankruptcy laws You either chicken or duck just like you either bankrupt or you re

text.title: SOUTH KOREA TO CHANGE POLICIES TO AVERT TRADE WAR
text.author: By Moon Ihlwan Reuters
text.body: South Korea decided on major changes trade investment finance policies aimed at reducing growth balance payments surplus avoiding trade war United States Deputy Prime Minister Kim Mahn je Kim told reporters excessively fast rise exports could make South Korea too reliant on exports increase nflation produce trade friction policy shift means abandoning Seoul s goal rapidly reducing foreign debt worked out at series ministerial meetings Kim who also Economic Planning Minister current account surplus previously expected to exceed eight billion dlrs year be held at five billion dlrs by increasing imports accelerating market liberalisation rationalising exports He Seoul try to limit current account surplus to around five billion dlrs year next few years although trade volume continue to grow This gradually reduce ratio surplus to GNP gross national product current five pct level to three pct by he added Koo Bon yong aide to Kim South Korea s foreign debt been expected to fall below billion dlrs by end against initial forecast billion billion dlrs at end But now with policy changes debt expected to remain above billion dlrs although could still be lower than originally projected billion dlrs he policy change announced two days before scheduled arrival U S Commerce Secretary Malcolm Baldrige talks Trade Minister Rha Woong bae South Korea under U S Pressure to reduce bilateral trade surplus rose to billion dlrs year billion dlrs Kim policy changes were also prompted by swing South Korea s current account to surplus billion dlrs first quarter deficit dlrs same period First quarter exports rose pct to billion dlrs government make foreign currency loans worth billion dlrs to firms willing to import capital goods raw materials equipment preferably U S He The foreign currency based loans carry interest at points above LIBOR London Interbank Offered Rate considerable incentives given to increase imports Koo Koo loans be repayable foreign currency It means they could become interest free loans if Korean currency continues to rise value he He South Korean won be revalued against dollar gradually but added We do believe rapid one shot changes value won won fixed at to dollar today risen six pct against dollar since beginning

reuters.unknown: RM f reute u f BC WORLD LENDING PATTERN

text.title: WORLD LENDING PATTERN CHANGING MANILA BANK CHIEF
text.body: International banks radically changed their attitudes towards debt lending debtor nations to explore new methods ensuring inflows Philippine Central Bank Governor Jose Fernandez Commercial banks tended to be rather difficult terms new money some time now he told reporters at news conference Within world there enormous changes taking place attitudes different banks He banks were no longer flush funds post oil boom were reluctant to lend money They don t same kind money they used to They find their whole deposit base eroding Fernandez Groups major banks decided international arena to their liking They wind up over Eurodollar rates who wants really s nothing They want to get frills but if they big enough they don t get frills Philippines on Wednesday announced wanted to renegotiate debt restructuring accord reached on March bank advisory committee saying wanted same terms as were granted to Argentina earlier week Argentina granted year repayment at points over Eurodollar rates same historically low spread Mexico won October while Philippines insisted on deal similar to Mexico s restructured billion dlrs billion dlr foreign debt at Fernandez old type new money agreement where hundreds banks were forced into involuntary lending by advisory committee negotiated agreements debtor countries becoming increasingly difficult He involuntary lending proved useful two or three years since Mexican debt crisis But present tendency been more more banks specially regionals or small ones either sold off their portfolios or simply by policy put up any more money Fernandez He another disturbing development so called national quota approach adopted by groups banks Groups banks by nationality chosen to take look at what other groups banks other countries willing to do if let us say British banks wind up giving pct what needed U S Banks give only pct then British banks say as whole they pull out he There banks decided lending good business any more They want to deal securities they want to go into investment banking they want to go into turnover business rather than carry business Fernandez We to thread our way through constellation banks all whom different objectives He order to survive Philippines to try stimulate new types inflows whether be direct investments whether be investments by institutions now chosen to lend but to invest or whether be debt to equity conversions
